snippet: Judges for a federal appellate court heard arguments over a Texas law that could lead to the closing of more than a dozen abortion clinics.
abstract: Judges for federal appellate court hear arguments over a Texas law that could lead to the closing of more than a dozen abortion clinics throughout the state; in March, same court gave Texas Republicans and anti-abortion groups a major victory in their legal battle to enforce the tough new abortion law that the Legislature passed last year, upholding one contested part of it as constitutional.
lead_paragraph: Judges for a federal appellate court heard arguments over a Texas law that could lead to the closing of more than a dozen abortion clinics.

headline.main: Both Sides Cite Urgency in Court Appeal of a Texas Law on Abortion Clinics
headline.print_headline: Both Sides Cite Urgency in Court Appeal of a Texas Law on Abortion Clinics
